WRITING.TEXT: regarding the blur in this game, I highly recommend going into the config file and add these lines, especially the first 4. the last 4 come at the cost of a few fps, make the game look better though. game looks phenomenal with this tuning. \[/Script/Engine.RendererSettings\] r.SceneColorFringe.Max=0 r.Tonemapper.Sharpen=0.6 r.DepthOfFieldQuality=0 r.MipMapLodBias=-1 r.ViewDistanceScale=4 r.SkeletalMeshLODBias=-2 r.StaticMeshLODDistanceScale=0.25 type %localappdata% in search bar then Packages -- gt; privatedivision...-- gt; LocalCache -- gt; Local -- gt; Indiana -- gt; Saved -- gt; Config -- gt; WindowsNoEditor and then open engine.ini save it afterwards. can't help ya with the performance issues though. game runs fairly well on my end, couple of fps drops in outside areas but overall pretty stable

being someone who definitely noticed an increase of microstutters even with improved hardware, I've tried lots of different things to mitigate said issue. I found two videos made by the same guy that are at least worth checking out. It's obviously hard to say if and what tweak might have decreased frametime spikes caused my windows. But it probably doesn't hurt trying. I stopped playing PUBG a long time ago but I definitely felt like it was running worse on my 2080ti, 8700k (windows 1803 and 1903) than on my 1080ti (windows 1709) #8203; here's the vids [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fOO2J9\_Aizs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fOO2J9_Aizs) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QR1kmd9kYVY](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QR1kmd9kYVY)
it's incredible. haven't been addicted to a game in...I don't even know how many years. can't put it down.

highly recommend tweaking the config file for this game as it greatly improves the visuals in this game. does look a bit blurry with all the stupid post processing effects (DOF, bloom, lens flare etc) on. add these lines to the engine.ini file and you got yourself an awesome lookin game \[/Script/Engine.RendererSettings\] r.SceneColorFringe.Max=0 r.Tonemapper.Sharpen=0.6 r.DepthOfFieldQuality=0 r.MipMapLodBias=-1 r.ViewDistanceScale=4 r.SkeletalMeshLODBias=-2 r.StaticMeshLODDistanceScale=0.25 #8203; as for the optimization. its got a lil bit of stuttering in outside areas, nothing too bad though. its smooth as butter inside and I'm pretty sure Obsidian is already working on the issue. #8203; Edit: you find the config file by typing %localappdata%" in search bar then: Packages -- gt; Private Division...-- gt;LocalCache -- gt; Local -- gt; Indiana -- gt; Saved -- gt; Config -- gt; WindowsNoEditor -- gt; then Engine.ini #8203; have fun

its quite honestly a must-play if youre a fan of the fallout formula. got a lil bit of everything: bit of bioshock vibes, mass effect, fallout, firefly all mixed together and still got it's own identity. I'm actually blown away by how addicted I am to it. haven't felt like this in a very very long time.
you aren't the brightest light in the sky are you?
what you're seeing here is copy pasted from my config file. so it should work by simply copy pasta'ing it. its basically one setting per line. no empty lines in between
both outer wilds and outer worlds absolute must-plays imo if you like space and exploring.

hmm i mean it's worth a try isn't it? People using Avast and BitDefender definitely resolved their launching issue by disabling it/whitelisting red dead. not really familiar with windows defender but shouldnt be too hard to whitelist red dead 2. let me know if it helped
I'm almost positive that Hardware Unboxed gonna come out with their best settings/optimization guide for this game fairly soon. lookin forward to it as well
I've maxed out the ingame TAA sharpening and added some sharpening via nvidia control panel as well. it's still a bit blurry but better than the aliasing due to msaa.

msaa and fxaa off, taa high, taa sharpening filter maxed and sharpening filter in nvidia control panel at 0.8 and ignore film grain 1.0 but it's a personal preference thing. I definitely think that arthur looks a bit too sharp with these settings but I take it as long as I can get the surroundings as sharp as possible. I'm pretty happy with the results. If I wasn't too lazy I'd show you a few screenshots. I hope you dont mind xD also, there's definitely graphic mods coming in the future that add a bit more clarity. apparently there's already reshade presets out but I'm playing on vulkan and setting up reshade for vulkan is apparently a pain in the butt.

It isn #8217;t a #8222; bug #8220; per se though. It #8217;s quad core cpus reaching their limit. Have been for quite a while actually. I #8217;m not defending this as there #8217;s definitely some issue and the game is definitely super power hungry ( maybe too much for what it #8217;s worth) but people need to realize that quad core cpus are kind of a thing of the past.

increased resolution scale to 1,25x and reduced a few settings to be able to maintain 60fps at 1440p and I feel like the overall image quality is significantly better compared to 1x resolution scale and overall higher settings.

I noticed sharpening works significantly better in dx12, especially the one in NVIDIA Control Panel. I #8217;ve been fiddling around with 1.25x res scale, ingame TAA sharpening and nvcp sharpening and it looks absolutely amazing. If you are on Vulkan, switch to dx12 and see the magic

CPU, RAM? I #8217;d lower reflection and water settings to medium and maybe volumetric settings as well if you need more fps. Also don #8217;t enable msaa. Stick to taa, add some sharpening and maybe consider increasing resolution scale to 1.25x if you #8217;re annoyed by the TAA blur. I #8216;ve been able to get a pretty incredible lookin game with this.

It 100% is tied to your pc power. And the fact that it happens with lowered settings is also logical because that puts even more stress on your cpu. In fact I #8217;m pretty sure you probably would get less stutters with higher video settings because you #8216;re much rather getting gpu bottlenecked than cpu bottlenecked. i haven #8217;t had a single fps drop on a 8700k with a mix of ultra and high settings, res scale 1.25x, 1440p. it #8217;s pretty much only people with i5s who been suffering from these issues.

Because you #8217;re bottlenecked by your 10 year old cpu. People have to realize that the days of quad cores are gone. Sure this game has issues but calling this a case of bad optimization when the game runs flawlessly on 6+core cpus is a bit questionable. I haven #8217;t had a single stutter yet, flawless 60 fps with perfect framepacing on a 8700k.
Yep. should #8217;ve said threads rather than cores :)

definitely some more taxing areas in the high 50s yeah but I'm also playing at 1440p with a 1,25x render scale to counter TAA blur ( I really recommend fiddling around with it. makes a significant difference). I'm usually someone who hates everythin below 100 but 60fps feel pretty smooth in this game.
ingame sharpening or nvcp/freestyle sharpening?
https://soundcloud.com/trommelmusic/trommel073-andrey-pushkarev def a lot of dub in this one but man I fuckin love pushkarev.

I highly recommend increasing your ingame res scale to 1.25x and lower some settings to counter the fps loss due to the higher res scale. It #8217;s not like it completely kills the side effects of TAA but it certainly helps the image quality

WRITING.TITLE: First Time Rave in Amsterdam - couple of questions
WRITING.TEXT: hey guys, #8203; 1.) this may as well be the most obsolete question I've ever asked but I'm actually really confused. I'm in Amsterdam this upcoming weekend. Not for the first time but the first time since I'm genuinely addicted to techno/house. What I'm mostly concerned with right now is, whether tickets are being sold at the doors as well or if clubs in Amsterdam handle it quite differently compared to Germany by selling their tickets exclusively via RA. The reason I'm askin this is, that there's no indication on RA. Not really much going on on friday but I've decided I'd check out Luciano in "de marktkantine", depending on whether the friends I'll be travelling with wanna join [https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1321296](https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1321296) What I'm really interested in is this event on saturday on Veronica Schip [https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1330232](https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1330232) (I know I know it's minimal house, don't hate me xD) but I simply cannot find out whether tickets are sold at the door as well. Reason is, my friends aren't as deep into electronic music as I am. I'd absolutely ditch them if they planned on going to some trash event but that really would be my last resort. So buying tickets at the door is what I'd prefer. do you guys know, if Marktkantine and Veronica Schip are usually selling tickets at the door, too? I've tried to reach out to Picnic London via Instagram and RA but didn't get a reply. 2.) Since clubs open earlier and close earlier than germany's, when are peak times to be expected? Are people going before midnight? #8203; Thank you

I mean getting em online isn't the problem. it's simply the fact I don't know if my friends are coming with me or not. Obviously I'd prefer raving/partying with them. I don't wanna waste money by buying a ticket for myself but end up in a different venue because I don't wanna ditch them xD

WRITING.TITLE: 2C-B as a temporary substitute to MDMA for music enhancement?
WRITING.TEXT: Sup dudes, let me start by saying that I pretty much only roll when I go to a rave. I'm a huge minimal/minimal house fan and been going to various events across europe. and obviously experiencing the likes of a:rpia:r on a roll is a mindblowing experience and made raving without it almost boring for me. that's pretty much why I took way too much mdma over the last 8 months. Anyway knowing that this isn't particularly good for my brain, I'm looking for substitutes, so I can fly to Mars more than once every 3 months. I've read quite a bit about 2C-B. Peace

WRITING.TEXT: Hey, let me start by talking a bit about myself, I #8216;m a 31 year old man who has been single for almost 3 years after a rough battle with my ex over the course of many years. Safe to say I was so sick of relationships I haven #8217;t even considered going for any nor have I met anyone who I considered #8222; good enough #8220; to open myself again. I also went through to final exams of my law studies which were followed of two years preparatory service that ended with what we call #8222; 2nd state exams #8220; just a month ago. I simply had been too busy to have the mindset for relationships. I #8217;m now waiting for results so I can finally work as a lawyer. I #8217;m a huge fan of electronic music. I was at a small to middle sized underground techno/house event here in Germany where this young DJane (shes 23) was playing, she #8217;s definitely on the raise, played the biggest clubs in my area, Mostly as warm-up to some pretty big names. It #8217;s the second time i saw her even though I didn #8217;t listen to her set the first time I saw her. Anyway, I noticed she was watching me after her set quite often and smiled when I looked her in the eyes. She actually asked me for a lighter later on even though she probably could have asked her friends behind the dj booth. I #8217;m horrible at having smalltalks so I didn #8217;t take advantage of that and did not talk to her besides: #8222;dope set btw #8220; We danced close to eachother later on. Listen I may have imagined things or interpret the situation the way I want it to be but Its really the first time I liked a girl at first sight really. I kinda wanna msg her on her instagram but don #8217;t know if a) I should do it and b) what to write. One of my best friends said,I shouldn #8217;t write anything related to her hobby/work as that would seem like some cheesy fan letter, what do you guys think? Did I fuck it up already by not using the chances I had or is a Instagram message of any sort a way to tell her that I really am interested in learning more about her. man i feel like a idiot tbh but on the other hand I really shouldn #8217;t give a fuck and just msg her right? I mean what #8217;s the worst thing that could happen?! Thank you

yeah it definitely feels like I missed my shot but then again, if she did like me, why wouldn't she appreciate a msg now. I do agree that her set should be my opener and I probably just should tell her the way I felt. That i did like her set and that I wouldve talked with her a bit more if we weren't surrounded by people and loud music lol. Her insta isn't as big as it may have seemed in my first msg (1k followers). Imma just tell her what I said and see how it goes. thank you

Ye I know about the mdma science. Couldn #8217;t help but consume it anyway mainly because I #8217;m super into electronic music. And we all know what an incredible experience this combination is. Anyway I #8217;m definitely taking a break and been looking for substitutes that don #8217;t mess up my brain as bad as mdma. Thank you for the heads up brother
Aight. Thank you :)

played every single halo back in the day, so essentially grew up with these games. was lookin forward to this release as well for obvious reasons and can't say I'm disappointed. however, I can't recommend it either at least if youre an enthusiastic gamer. I'm running a pretty beefy setup and I just can't cope with various and obvious issues that will or won't get fixed. fps doesn't feel smooth at all (playing unlimited). I gotta admit I'm pretty sensible to unstable fps but 140fps simply don't feel like 140 fps in this game. it hurts also movement feels ridiculously sluggish. I don't know if Halo Reach just didn't age well or if its an issue within the game but if you're used to modern fps, it's gonna hurt sound is bad yes but it doesn't bother me as much as the fps and movement issues. Listen, it's one of the best fps series ever created and if youre just playing it for the story and especially as a preparation for Halo Infinite, go for it. 10bucks or 40 for the entire collection is probably a steal. but I can't overlook issues just because of a low prize. they bother me as much as they would in a full prized 60 #8364; game. #8203; my personal recommendation: get yourself a gamepass sub for 1 buck.
aight. much appreciated dude lt;3

absolutely mental. didn't stay for much of Ricardo's set, not really big of fan of his sound, really depends on how high he is essentially lol. but Rhadoo obviously blew me away. if you ever have the chance, go to Robert Johnson bro. it's by far my favorite club in the world. there's something about it that no other club got, besides its ridculous sound system.

ricardo is hit or miss imo. really depends on how high he is essentially lmfao. saw him a couple of months ago alongside rhadoo at robert johnson. he played in the early morning till 12pm. wasn't my thing but I've got a pretty distinct taste when it comes to minimal house/minimal techno.

not saying it's good to take it as many times as you did but holy fuck the paranoia on this sub regarding molly more than once every 3 months is real. WRITING.TITLE: What can I expect from a Mall Grab clubnight in 2020?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys, wanna make it short. Basically Mall Grab is playing at Robert Johnson alongside Willow this upcoming weekend. I know a lot of his uplifting House stuff (which I like) and also know that his past sets from like 2016+ were housy for the most part. Now, referring to his latest Boiler Room and Glitch Festival sets it tend to be a lot more electro and techno, but usually a lot of different genres packed in one. Now I'm generally not against either of those. I love techno, I'm also a big house fan, not so much of an electro fan but I usually don't like several genres mixed into one set. Most importantly though, I wanna know what to expect from a clubnight I plan on going to. here for anyone interested: [https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1363939](https://www.residentadvisor.net/events/1363939) Anyone seen him lately?

upgraded from a 1080ti to a 2080ti a year ago. thought that Metro Exodus was pretty damn impressive and is prolly the most immersive game I've played in my life (partly due to RTX). performance hit was actually pretty alright (except maybe forest level) Control's graphics and rtx features were pretty good as well, game bored me to death after a while though. also thought the game didn't look as good as people made it out, it's insanely blurry, with a lot of "visual noise". the performance hit on 1440p was insane as well. didn't bother with other games. If I were you, I'd really ask myself whether I have to play the currently available rtx games. if you consider an rtx gpu for next gen games (cyberpunk, Doom etc), I'd probably wait for ampere as next gen is supposed to be a lot better than the current one. now, do I think the upgrade was worth the 1300 #8364;? definitely not. shouldve just kept my 1080ti.

ye I don't know why I didn't like the game as much as I expected. I'm a big Remedy fan but Control felt like it was being weird just for the sake of being weird. hard to explain. also the gameplay loop was a bit too easy. you could basically spam telekinesis all the time while hiding behind your cover. I dunno. I'm old (31) lol. not as easy to impress me as it used to be. the game looked good. don't get me wrong and the RTX features themselves were really impressive. the game as a whole was a bit underwhelming. but yeah, like you said, thats totaly subjective

I'm living close to Mannheim. Mannheim itself got hit pretty hard just recently with the forced closure of Parker Lewis. one of only two techno/house focused clubs in the city. the other one, Disko 2, isn't really worth considering. It got some pretty decent bookings here and then (minimalistica) but basically nothing I'd ever prefer over taking the train to Robert Johnson. now the city itself is pretty cool. I've never been a fan of insanely big cities but Mannheim is kinda in a sweetspot. got that big city vibes but also a lot of parks, Altstadt, and that kinda cozy vibe with a a lot of cultural stuff as well. like ezymnz already said, it's basically in the middle of a big urban area with Frankfurt am Main really close (one of Germany's richest cities). now, talking about Frankfurt regarding techno is a whole nother story. Robert Johnson has been considered as one of the world's best clubs for quite a while. and honestly imo it is. now I haven't been to many outside of Germany but compared to Berlin, it's definitely on the same level, if not even better. crazy soundsystem, all the bookings youre looking for with a big emphasis on house/minimal though. I don't even hesitate to take the 90min train to the club because I know I'll be having a magical night there. FFM got a few amount of other decent clubs. Tanzhaus West is well known, much more techno focused, but imo a bit too fucked up lol. to each his own though. Off Yard and Silbergold are also decent venues. now back to Mannheim being in a big urban area, there's really a lot to that area and easy to arrive with train. Worth mentioning is that, Mannheim's got a huuge US background with one of the biggest US army bases in the country being in Mannheim. it generally is a very international city. I can't remember a single day in the city when I haven't heard at least one person speaking english if music culture is your priority, I don't think youre gonna be disappointed. now personally, I'd have a hard time passing on Madrid. the weather, the food, the chicks... maybe I'm just biased towards something different since I'm a german, who been living his whole life in Germany lol. don't think you'd regret either of those choices though. have fun. and if you actually come to Mannheim, feel free to msg me if you don't wanna solo rave at Robert Johnson.

bit off-topic, since you were mainly asking for club advice but I wanna take the time and encourage you to actually do it. it's honestly the best thing I did in the last couple of years. I had been partying with the same group for many many years. good friends don't get me wrong but they never jumped on the techno/house train as much as I did a couple of years ago. and when they actually did join me, it usually ended with one of them wanting to go home at fuckin 5am (I'm german, so they basically wanted to bail when the main-act started his set lol) or generally standing at the bar because they didn't feel the music to dance as much as I do. It started to bother me, so I went out solo for the first time and from that night on, I refused to go out with the homies several time. I simply prefer going alone. you'd much rather meet new, interesting, funny people. You can dance as long as you want without feeling the pressure of making your friends happy, because you were the guy who decided to go to that specific club in the first place. I stayed till 10am, 11am up until the club closed... the best I'm tellin ya. so don't hesitate. it's awesome (I'm 31 btw)

WRITING.TITLE: I'm lookin for appropriate literature for beginners with an emphasis on stress/sleep issues
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys, I've been following this sub for a few days now. A few days ago I received a letter that really made me realize I have to change things. Let me introduce myself and further explain what I mean. I'm 31 man, studied and graduated in german law a couple of years ago,before I started what we basically call "preparatory service". A mandatory 2 years with different stations at different courts before you have another final "state exams". If you pass this one, you're finally what we call "Volljurist"; a jurist qualified to become judge, state attorney, lawyer etc. Well, I didn't pass this 2nd state exams. It's the first time in my life that I haven't passed en exam/test. But if I'm totally honest, it should've happened earlier, because the main issue has always been the same: I cannot fuckin sleep prior to big events. It usually ends with panic attacks, where stress gets so ahold of me that even sleep pills wouldn't affect me. Happened before first state exams (the one that finishes your studies), but I passed it. It happened before oral exams, it even happened before work, when I was afraid of not being able to sleep. Now back to the fact, I didn't pass this oh so important 2nd state exams. It isn't the end of it. I do have another last try next autumn and I wanna make sure that this unnecessary issue isn't stopping me to finish what began almost 10 years ago when I started to study this shit. Several people told me about meditation several times, especially guided towards stress relief and sleeping issues. Obviously trying it in the heat of the battle wouldn't work. So I never really gave it a try when I had time to learn it. I wanna read more about this topic and while I obviously have checked amazon for recommendations regarding meditation, the sheer amount of literature makes it hard to decide what really would benefit me. I don't really wanna read 10 books before I know what helps and what not. So, what's your recommended literature. I don't mind stuff with an emphasis on the philosophical background of meditation. However, I think books with an emphasis on the procedure of meditation is probably what I really need or what would at least be a good start to potentially dig further into it. #8203; Anyways, thank you guys already. #8203; TL;DR: guy with huge stress/sleep issues the night before important events needs literature recommendations with an emphasis on the procedure of meditation.

I really couldn't have asked for more. this is basically everything I've been looking for. I'll contact one of those MBSR teachers in my area and see whether it's affordable.It might even be covered my health insurance (partly at least). I'll also be lookin into those two books you recommended. I told myself to distance myself from that failed exam for a week or two. gonna use this time to read into that topic. thank you once again.

as much as I love mdma, I'd really stay away from it on a regular basis. take it once every two months sure, maaaybe once a month if there's really someone you must see but don't get sucked into it. this is from my very own experience, going through a phase of popping E almost every weekend for a solid 5 months and it made me extremely careless and irresponsible regarding my obligations. It was right before my final state exams in german law (which I didn't pass, received results just a few days ago) eductate yourself on neurotoxicity of mdma. it really changes your view on this drug, at least regarding the abuse of it. I think you should be fine with speed every once in a while. as with all things: don't abuse it or it definitely will catch up on you (had a pretty hefty phase back in my school time, had to do 12th grade again due to my weed and speed "addiction). there's one drug, I read a lot about when I was looking for an mdma substitute. that's "3-FPM", really don't know how hard or easy it is to find in Berlin. eductate yourself on it, it might be something for ya if you need a break from those rather toxic stuff. #8203; last but not least: try raving "sober" every once in a while. it really isn't that bad. the best of the best DJs make you high with their music and only with their music. have a couple of drinks and actually remember the set the next day ( something I kinda hate with xtc lol) Viel Spa #223; in Berlin Edit: agree'd on the exercising and healthy nutrition part. It really does help a lot

WRITING.TITLE: GH010 ::: Arapu by Club Guesthouse

WRITING.TEXT: Robert Johnson is generally speaking just a prime example of how a dancefloor should be built. DJ booth is on the same level as dancefloor, no sort of barrier between booth and dancefloor, causing this really intimate feeling. It just feels like DJ and crowd is one unit and I lost count of how many magic moments I've had due to this intimate feeling. Saw Maayan Nidam couple of months ago, it was 7am, she played a super deep cut, had my eyes shut while dancing,opened my eyes and she was lookin me right into the eyes for a splitsecond. made my night tbh. I'd definitely miss this personal connection between both DJ and crowd, if there wasn't a DJ behind the booth. It would feel just like those boring hiphop parties I used to go when I was young and didn't know this magic called techno. the way it is, it really feels like a journey and the DJ decides where you're heading

niiiiice! thanks for sharing. Cap is probably my favorite romanian these days. has been since I saw him live last august. got me in a different state like no other has. and gescu surely one of the most groovy out there. love em both.

who the fuck cares what you're expected to do? in reality people actually adore you for doing that shit because believe it or not, a lot of people are not able to do that. went to a NYE rave alone, met some italians who took a flight to Frankfurt specifically for that event and they were super hyped when I told them, that I was there alone (had to take a 2hrs train to get there).

I can relate a lot. I've been enjoying solo raving and make the best out of it. obviously appreciating the benefits of it: no worries whether friends enjoy themselves, you can come/leave whenever you want, do whatever you want BUT enjoying this with friends that are on the same page as you is definitely a wonderful experience I miss. Unfortunately my friends don't dig it as much as I do. when we were introduced to the scene like two years ago, It was only me who got addicted to it. these goddamn normies prefer going to latina nights or some shit like that lol. they also don't get when I tell them, a techno event is much more than a party for me....either way, it is what it is and I definitely love solo-raving but I miss these few raves with my homies.
Can anyone explain?

you'll never find out whether you like it or not if you don't try it. I actually hesitated too before I did for the first time. Since then I've gradually fallen in love with it more and more until it became my prefered way of raving at least under the given circumstances. My friends aren't really that much into the music. they did wanna join me here and then but it usually ended with them wanting to leave at around 5-6, which is basically when the headliners are playing here in Germany. obviously would love to have friends, sharing the same mindset but it is what it is. met some cool raving buddies but it's not really the same as having your best friends around you. anyways, just do it. Greetings from someone who had the same doubts as you

except the romanians play actual "danceable" music. this insanely fast hard banging techno is just a constant peaktime for...well...3+hrs. it can only get so fast without losing "musical richness"

it's definitely influenced by dub techno yea. When I discovered the romanian sound I really thought it had the perfect mix of deep house, minimal, and dub techno. upon first impression you would think that most of the romanians sound same-y but most of them do actually have a unique sound if you listen carefully. ranges from really really dark (rhadoo's 2017 dommune is a perfect example) to really warm and groovy house (Arapu, Gescu, Raresh) I've spent almost a year digging through the sound, been to a couple of rominimal raves across europe and I'm not even close of being bored by it :)

actually an accumulation of different factors 1.) I was (part of me still is) a huge hiphop head but going to concerts and events here in Germany never gave me that feeling of being surrounded by likeminded people rather than just a whole lot of different people that werent necessarily there for the music. and I'm the typa person who loves to talk about the shit I'm passionate about.also hiphop got really fuckin weird over these last couple of years with trap and this mumble shit taking over leading to less and less bookings and events of the artists I've been digging. first couple of clubnights gave me that incredible feeling of being surrounded by people who are as passionate about music as I am. immediately got addicted to this scene. 2) drugs now don't get me wrong. when I go to a rave/clubnight I go for the music. but MDMA kinda served as that initiating push. the first couple of times I listened to techno was always on drugs. once I got addicted (to the music), I obviously started listening to it sober. but this combination still is something special to me. 3.) minimal/house. without minimal/house, especially the romanian stuff I would've never made that "next step". I think it's a lot more accessible than techno. It also proved to be true that you often start with slow stuff and listen to harder and faster stuff later on :) 4.) Rodhad my first techno rave. still is my favorite.

WRITING.TITLE: CDV TV | Arno - label owner and resident DJ at Robert Johnson, one of Germany's best techno/house clubs, playing a hiphop instrumentals only set... and it's dope af. Enjoy!

WRITING.TEXT: what a comment this! fully agreed btw. I'm still pretty new to the scene. 31 years old, listened to hiphop for more than 20 years and even though I considered myself enthusiastic and sorta addicted to the music and the digging it didn't even come close to what I felt when I got introduced to the techno and romanian minimal scene. one and a half years later, I'm bedroom dj'ing when I get the time to. bought some turntables, a two channel mixer, some monitors and a shitton of records, not even counting the ridiculous amount of time I spend lookin for new tracks and records I could buy and implement in my "for-my-own-pleasure" mixes at home. It's definitely an addiction and I fuckin love it. I don't even wanna talk about the out of this world parties. we all know it's pure magic and there's definitely part of me who's a bit sad that I found this love in my early 30s now after having finished law studies and starting to work as a jurist with the ridiculous amount of hrs that come with this job. can't wait to get back on the dancefloor.

WRITING.TITLE: Sepp amp; Nu Zau // Live Studio Session_10 // Sunrise Hub

WRITING.TEXT: I'm still a beginner really but I'm quite happy with my reloops 7000 mk2. I've tested 1210s before buying them. obviously would've gotten 1210 if there had been decently prized used ones but at the end I didnt really see a point spending 450 euro for 15+ year old technics when I could get completely new reloops that are actually quite similar in a non club environment. so got two of those with concorde mix mkII twin systems. a xone 23c (because I'm still considering setting up DVS) and... let me tell you a whole lot of records. I actually started buying records way before I got my turntables. it's become such an addiction really. basically ordering at least 5 newly released records a month + used old ones I cant get on deejay/decks anymore. It's a lot of fun though both the digging and the playing and learning process.
hate? I'm pretty happy DJs like him, Solomun or the drumcode artists exist, attracting all the mainstream crowds, keeping my raves nice and clean! keep it going Boris

it blows my mind how young Cosmjn is, considering how long he's been around and especially considering how good of a producer he already is as well. if he keeps going like that, he'll be one of the greatest in the future. dope set too

well tbh I cant see it happening earlier than november here in germany either. and that's even with the comparably decent progress we've made. according to the most recent virologist reports, the virus spreads through aerosols like crazy and I can honestly not imagine a place with less airflow than your standard techno club lol. I hope that clubs might work something out and can host some sort of small scale outdoor events. I can somewhat see those happening in late august/ early september but then again, it wouldnt really be the same would it? sucks really but thats the situation we're in
holy moly what a tune. thx for sharing
their next release is a Tulbure release. highly anticipating that one
saw her live at robert johnson last october from 6-9am. played some magical tunes exactly what the crowd needed at that time. good dj and a talented producer as well

that is literally not true. Im not even from the UK and my instagram timeline is full of UK events all the time. london regularely hosts rominimal parties. (the stump hosts a sick 24hrs event regularly),animal crossing is responsible for several big ass parties across the UK (mainly manchester) with SIT, Arapu, Gescu etc etc. Dubla hosts also a ton of parties across the UK

oh ye scotland is obviously a different story. still worth to follow those people and maybe attend one of the more underground parties with people that know what they come for. I've travelled to Fabric once and despite the good soundsystem, I hated it lol. really weird vibe there.

I'm not from the UK either. living close to Frankfurt,germany, so pretty fortunate to have Robert Johnson in my area. you do mention an interesting point though. I came to the conclusion that the more popular the DJs the less I like the vibe. as much as I love rhadoo (and he still is my favorite romanian dj), I've seen him play twice and both times the vibe was average compared to a clubnight with lesser known romanians like Cap. still enjoyed myself because the music was dope but there was definitely more people that weren't as big into rominimal, just happened to be there because they've heard the name "rhadoo". dude, it actually blows my mind why you guys don't have a better club scene, given the insane talent thats coming from France. some of my favorite djs/producers are from Paris.

this is what I love about the romanian sound tho. I feel like it got a bit of everything. pretty convinced everybody can find at least one romanian whose sound is exactly what he's lookin for. it covers a pretty wide range of different sounds. everybody who says the romanians sound all the same really got no clue. my personal taste really changed over the years, I was big into the more housy romanians first, but been getting more into the more minimal DJs. really digging Crihan these days. if you havent seen his Sunrise hub set, do yourself a favor and watch it. it's a nice trip. and ye Cap...I think he's gonna be one of the greatest in a couple of years. dude's got insane flow imo. gotta dig more into Herodot's sound man. I haven't really listened to a lot of his. whats your favorite set of his?

I recently got into it, missed dancefloors so decided on getting some equipment. been loving every single minute of it. surely digging and copping records is one helluva an addicting hobby (and an expensive one too) but the learning process is rewarding, mixing is fun, almost calming in a way and it really intensified my passion for electronic music. highly recommended. I'm running two reloops 7000 mk2, a xone 23c 2channel mixer and some adams T7Vs. lovely budget setup :)

There isn #8217;t a single set of his that isn #8217;t dope as hell imo. If you wanna laugh your ass off due to the over the top visuals by cot #233; watch caps set for sunwaves quarantine stream https://youtu.be/yrvciDfIVl0a ( Starts at 7:54:00) Sunwaves 2018: https://soundcloud.com/playedby/cap-at-sunwaves-24-21082018 https://soundcloud.com/trommelmusic/trommel084-cap-b2b-suciu ( b2b with suciu, very dope)

WRITING.TITLE: Andrey Pushkarev - 8 hours live stream @ WHO I AM Gallery, Moscow 30-05-2020 part1
Considering upgrading my cartridges - how's the Ortofon Concorde Club MK2 system?
WRITING.TEXT: hey guys, bedroom beginner DJ here. I've been considering upgrading my cartridges from the rather basic reloop black concorde to the ones mentioned in the title. [https://www.thomann.de/de/ortofon\_concorde\_club\_mkii\_system.htm](https://www.thomann.de/de/ortofon_concorde_club_mkii_system.htm) I've heard really good things about these especially regarding audio quality (lots of details in the highs and mids). Would this purchase be a noticeable upgrade? I do feel like, the highs and mids are a bit dull with the ones I'm currently using.
whole ep is fire. will be out next week btw

so in theory, the first signal I'd max out is the individual channels right? so in my case on a xone 23c with 2 turntables connected to phono, Id max out those 2 phono signals. then, again in theory, the monitors and then the master signal on my mixer?

pretty sure that Dubla hosts parties at monastery digbeth in birmingham regularely with proper artists (SIT, Gescu etc). I'm not English so can't tell if these parties are worth but I'd definitely follow them on socials

a big supermarket company in germany. didn't even know they were a thing outside of germany lol. now they hosting fucking Sunrise. but ye, sets insane and I fully agree on what you say about the romanian sound. it really is on a different level. by far the most versatile and enjoyable sound to me.

are they? I'm based in Germany so don't know exactly what's happening in Romania. I saw there's an evening event with cosmjn and Amorf but thats about it I think. thats basically all I can see happening not only in Romania but in all of Europe, couple of early evening "parties". clubs are definitely shut till end of october here :( I think Supermarket in Zurich is hosting a mid day event today as well from 2pm to midnight. I mean, it's nice that things are slowly getting back and DJs can earn a couple of bucks but I'm the: all or nothing kinda guy. I wanna experience the full 5th gear rave from 2am till 11am, fully mollied out of my mind and with a packed dancefloor.
goddamn. priku is just pure magic and Maher Daniel is absolutely solid as well.
I mean Priku is in my top 10 favorite DJs. he's masterclass. haven't heard a single set of his that I didn't enjoy. generally speaking enjoying the romanian sound a lot. became my favorite sound tbh.

WRITING.TITLE: Having issues with a used reloop 7000 mk2 I just got - grinding noises
WRITING.TEXT: Hey guys, I just received a used reloop 7000 mk2 but I'm hearing some sort of "grinding noise" coming from the platter (or rather the connection between the platter and the motor). I can't really locate what exactly causes it. the platter definitely doesn't rotate smoothly,especially compared to the other reloop I'm having. obviously it's possible that I got scammed. seller says, it was definitely working flawlessly. so before I make any assumptions I wanna make sure that I'm not being stupid and missing something. Has anyone of you guys had similar issues? I can make some videos if that explains my issues better. but like I said, basically platter isn't really connected to the turntable. anything I can do to fix it? could the magnet be the issue?

yep, platter was removed. it's a bit of a weird one, there's moments where I barely hear it and then it's pretty noticeable (as in a split second of grinding noise). also I'm not entirely sure if it slows down the record or not ( as fucked up as it is, I can somehow live with it as long as I can mix without issues). anyway, your comment helps a bit. I might check the motor and see if I can fix it.

WRITING.TITLE: What's the required setup to record with a Xone 23c ?
WRITING.TEXT: Sup everybody, hope you're doing fine all things considered, I finally wanna record my first vinyl only sets. I'm having a xone 23c mixer, but apparently people reporting that recording isn't as simple as it seemed to me, as some of the recording tools would only record one channel rather than the master output?! Now obviously I wanna record my master. What's the recommended app? I hear audacity is alright? #8203; anything else I should be aware of? What are the connections between mixer and pc supposed to look like? via USB right? I do have a budget audio interface here? is it recommended to use that for recording? #8203; thanks and stay safe
very very grateful for this! thank you very much. gonna try what you just recommended :)

yea, I'm pretty sure that this might resolve the issues. the grinding noises are barely noticeable at times, then after a bit of backqueuing, it sometimes comes back for a few rotations. turned on my decks this morning and it was completely gone. thank you, gonna see how I can fix this without any repair costs :)

good share. giving me a feeling of Mihigh x old Rhadoo vibes. definitely one of the newcomers to look out for. got a decent discography on bandcamp already. I think there's a big LP in the works and about to be released soon-ish as well. looking forward to more of his. #8203; Edit: yep, here's a first "glimpse" of that big ROOT release I'm talking about [https://www.facebook.com/theaviarymusic/?fref=mentions amp;\_\_tn\_\_=KH-R](https://www.facebook.com/theaviarymusic/?fref=mentions amp;__tn__=KH-R)

hey man, just wanted to thank you. it was actually a lack of lubrication that caused the grinding noises. bought a small bottle of special turntable motor lubrication and it fixed my issues entirely. man I'm happy as fuck lol. thank you

the T7V's are awesome. reason why I got these over any other monitors in that price range is the low end on those. they def got enough bass for my room while still maintaining the clarity of monitors. good product for the money (you can get those used for around 300 #8364; if youre lucky)

love this guy. tbh he's probably the dopest live act I've seen over the years. played with his band, which by itself is such a nice and gifted band. but man, liveband hiphop acts are definitely something special and his gig has stayed in my mind ever since. lookin forward to this. like someone else here has already stated, it's been a while and considering that Oddisee has always been focusing on the deeper topics of life, I'm pretty sure he's got a lot to talk about.

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for a specific bass-heavy minimal
WRITING.TEXT: Hey, hope you're all doing fine all things considered. Besides my love for proper banging techno, I'm also a big sucker for good minimal techno, especially from the ro scene. However I've been having a hard time finding what I really look for. a lot of newer stuff is pretty " high hatty" and is more minimal-house than straight up minimal. as a reference: big fan of rhadoos, dubtil's, crihan's and VID's style. phat basslines, little to no high hats, deep, dark, hypnotic, not too abstract. basically like this here: [https://youtu.be/ihU0VzGccz4?t=139](https://youtu.be/ihU0VzGccz4?t=139) or this [https://youtu.be/m\_ZqqtvNt0I?t=64](https://youtu.be/m_ZqqtvNt0I?t=64) or this [https://soundcloud.com/afterhours-uk-au/a1-vid-versavice-afhr002#t=0:38](https://soundcloud.com/afterhours-uk-au/a1-vid-versavice-afhr002#t=0:38) Haven't asked in the official minimal subreddit. pretty sure they'd hit me with Villalobos, which I'm not lookin for.

oh I know them ofc. all dope and I dig em (saw the arpiar guys several times). however I'm currently more on the hunt of this rather dark but still groovy style of VID and Crihan. Raresh is too spacy. Pedro's style is more what I'm lookin for. I've gone through his Dommunes which are all insane but obviously most of this is unreleased and will probably always be lmfao. Sunwaves sets tend to be very high hatty for the most part, which makes sense. need that high energy stuff there. Rhadoos sunwaves from 2012 is one of my alltime faves of sunwaves though. basically, I want the raw tracks. going through the sets (and I'm pretty sure Ive listened to every set of those artists you mentioned) is going to end in tears because I wont get the IDs lmao. thanks man.

that's what I love about the ro scene man. so many different vibes within the scene. from super abstract and minimalistic, to dark, bass heavy minimal and groovy house. love this shit. I wish Crihan would release half of the tracks he plays in his sets. dude's sound is perfect minimal in my ears.

oh you chose the right fucking set. incredible journey this one. he's a really good producer (and dj). you've prolly heard a lot of his productions in some of the OG's sets. he's been producing under different aliases, Crihan and Discret Popescu being his most prevalent. enjoy brother

get one of those super OEM decks. they're great value for the money. I'm no veteran by any means, I've only been spinning on my reloop 7000 mk2 for a year now, tried 1200s at a friend's place too and I really don't see a point copping 10-15 yo technics for the money of a new reloop 7000, when they are actually of a really similar-ish quality, especially in a non-club-environment. I feel like the pitch control can be a bit fiddly at times, meaning it does get out of sync after a while, but thats nothing I can't work with. check some reviews on yt comparing technics to those reloops for further information :)
